sentences.english: He kept chopping about from kindness to cruelty towards his pupils.
sentences.chinese: 他對學生們忽而和藹可親，忽而冷酷無情。

sentences.english: Some men are cold, they're callous and they're mean.
sentences.chinese: 有的男人冷酷無情，吝嗇不堪。
他是個冷酷無情的衣冠禽獸。

sentences.english: But the Queen Mother of ruthless, and finally he just break up this pair of happy couples.
sentences.chinese: 然而王母冷酷無情，最後硬是拆散了這對恩愛夫妻。

sentences.english: Capitalism, perhaps at its most remorseless, is a physical manifestation of psychopathy.
sentences.chinese: 冷酷無情的資本主義正是精神疾病的物質表現。
她冷酷無情的態度引起我的反感。

sentences.english: Scarlett becomes hard-hearted as she works to save the farm and house.
sentences.chinese: 郝思嘉努力工作拯救農場及家園，變得冷酷無情。

sentences.english: He stretched himself on her threshold and uttered his complaints to the cruel bolts and bars .
sentences.chinese: 他匍伏在她門檻上對着冷酷無情的插銷門栓傾訴哀怨。

sentences.english: He needled me with his heartlessness.
sentences.chinese: 他的冷酷無情刺傷了我的心。
貪婪使他變得冷酷無情。

sentences.english: And you are one cold-hearted person.
sentences.chinese: 而你則是一個冷酷無情的人。

sentences.english: I did not think Charles would have been so unfeeling.
sentences.chinese: 我原來以爲他不至於會這麼冷酷無情。

sentences.english: But none was as ruthless as Gul'dan.
sentences.chinese: 但是沒有人比古爾丹更冷酷無情。

sentences.english: Nor silver - shedding tears could penetrate her uncompassionate sire.
sentences.chinese: 銀光閃閃的淚花也不能打動她冷酷無情的父親。
貪婪使他變得冷酷無情。

sentences.english: Sincere words reacted on the cold-hearted person.
sentences.chinese: 真誠的話語對這個冷酷無情的人起了作用。

definition: to patch up one's lie (when inconsistencies appear)/to cover (for sb who has lied)
to murder without blinking an eye (idiom)/ruthless/cold-blooded
lit. to hate iron for not becoming steel/to feel resentful towards sb for failing to meet expectations and impatient to see improvement (idiom)
to rob the rich to help the poor
to have no sense of shame/brazen
full of youthful vigor (idiom)/in the prime of youth
to refute/to demolish (an argument, theory etc)
to submit to the will of heaven/to resign oneself to fate/to trust to luck
without a retreat route/caught in a dead end/having burned one's bridges
